text: hi everyone, anywork worked on Firebase JobDispatcher yet?
How I can make my jobservice run on connection changes?

why cant we communicate from fragment to activity with this ->  
`MyActivity myact = (MyActivity) getActivity(); `
` myact.doSomthing();`

here we can ask activity to do something without making any interface ?
It is not as flexible as interfaces.
you can, but it’s ugly
if you want to use your fragment elsewhere
it gets messy
interfaces you can use on multiple activities, and you can enforce their use if required

then how to make calls from activity to fragment ?
`MyFragment frag = (MyFragment) fragmentsList.get(1)`
find fragment by tag, or id, or send local broadcast

or use eventbus
i heard, this was normal way to communicate between fragments and activities
now my colleague tries to implement rxjava way
I prefer rxjava as a bus vs eventbus as it doesn't require random methods all over your code base that look unused until you compile
<@U055GGAHS> nice argument
I'm using local broadcast receiver to communicate between fragments and activities
That works too

u can combine it with RxBroadcast
may be… this is best solution

attachments.fallback: [January 13th, 2017 4:28 PM] arviio: I'm using local broadcast receiver to communicate between fragments and activities

text: I realized if I use rxjava I'd have to recode my entire project... I think RxJava is fine if you start MVP pattern... but for a beginner like me... this is just overwhelming
:smile: hope that helps

@arvil i’am beginner too and i have had no rx experience some time ago. 
switching to rx was smooth and easy, but brings lot of redesigns =(
but now i understand that it was nice solution
rxjava has a steep learning curve
if you’re just starting out, it’s not essential
you can do mvp/clean code without it
<@U04U5KS3Z> indeed... i'll try rxjava on personal projects <@U3J6W9P0W> what's your networking with Rx? Retrofit?
I remember watching this one hour android rxjava on youtube and it didn't sink in... then I study local broadcast manager... and baam it was simple :sweat_smile:
Please I've heard enough of the Rx sturvs, can anyone gimme a pointer as to how it really work on Android, I've heard rumors its about  the observer design pattern
<@U3QSQQP9C> this is what I've watched... maybe it'll help you <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3D0cWyNno4>

text:
<@U37BP6E73> no, it is too easy
i have project, where i should to communicate with server over all-time opened socket connection, so i can’t send request and receive response, i should send request and then decide, which of this responses is mine and route it to observer from UI

so… it was hard to decide, how to add rx in this task, but i found solution on one russian site (i’am from russia) <http://habrahabr.ru|habrahabr.ru> 
there was article about rx subjects. but some time later i switched to processors from rxjava 2, cos subjects gave me errors.

here is article: <https://habrahabr.ru/post/270023/>

then i opened RxBroadcasts and now i combine rxbroadcast and processors

<@U0548MM6B> hey I was not intending to directly copy an existing app. I don't know exactly what you are working on, but I am just working on a side project to build up my portfolio. I don't really have an intent on launching the app. It will probably remain an open source app.
hahaha no problem man, we’ve got a similar movie grid in our testing phase right now :smile:
not many ways one can do it
looks cool tho
btw if you’re implementing rx you don’t have to redo all your code
pew, it was hard to write and structure logically, cos i have a lot of “fire-at-the-hole” working on this task

text: Same as anything, implement it for what you need now, then redo the rest of your code later when you have the time and more understanding
Doing an eventbus with Rx though isn’t too hard and if that’s all you require it for then you can just do it where you need it
I’ve got a couple of event buses used for forwarding `onActivityResult` to certain views which are generated programatically (bit of a hack, but it works)
<@U1LJG0Y03> I see, maybe because the example I saw was using Retrofit, and I'm already using Volley... :smile_cat: I'll give rxjava another try <@U3J6W9P0W> thanks
Does anyone know of a MVVM project that does not use databinding?
<@U05473HHT> you can easily MVVM with RxJava
<https://kickstarter.engineering/open-sourcing-our-android-and-ios-apps-6891be909fcd#.171373kv9>

text: <@U3R8HHDKM|lumb> has joined the channel

Is it possible to do a `Observable.combineLatest()` call inside a `Observable.flatMap()`?  So i have an `EditText` that i am monitoring the changes with `RxTextView.textChanges()` to turn it into an `Observable`.  Then i added a `debounce()` operator with a 400 ms timeout.  And then in my Rx chain i would like to spawn three separate API calls and use the `combineLatest()` operator.   But I’m not sure how to compose this Rx chain.  Any ideas?
<@U0A1BE7KQ> you can just flatMap into a Func that returns the combineLatest observable can't you?
`textChanges().debounce().flatMap(text -> combineLatest(apiCall1(text), apiCall2(text), apiCall3(text), Func3<blah blah>()))`
is there a way to access the failed observable inside of a flatMap later on?
so you could retry for instance?
the Android file systems is stupid
been battling it all day
finally won
All I wanted to do was grab an image from the system and upload it
but you have to make 3 or 4 different solutions depending on the SDK level
and then ofc I needed a custom convertor to convert the response
and then custom converter to upload .....and the list goes on
what's wrong with the unix filesystem?
its not unix
its Android
Depending on the Android version you have to do differnt things to get file path
and then you need permissions
the filesytem != android sdk
I know that OFc
lol
yeah im not sure what you are talking about, the security model on android blocks you from a lot of things without root
at the end of the day though almost every phone is running ext4
the permissions are the only thing standing in the way of anyone whose app you have installed messing with your life/files
I have an image picker you choose an image from the gallery and then you use a content provider to grab the path
yes
but depending on the Android version you need a different solution
to get path
oh you mean things not always being in the same place
why are you messing with file paths for that
ye and the sdk cahnges
I need to make a file for multipart upload
with retofit
its done now anyway
right so you should copy the image locally through the content provider instead of trying to get the file on disk
it’s going to bug out on you on random devices just fyi
I have it as a bitmap
I should convert the bitmap to a file and pas it around my code?
you could use the `Environment` class which is supposed to give you the correct paths backwards compatible
sure but I still need the path to the file

not knowing anything about your app and having done a lot of stuff like that I can tell you that if you are trying to use file paths and handle sdk levels and such, you’ll find devices and apps that bend the rules it will blow up on you (assuming you are browsing images you dont control like on the sdcard or generated by other apps)
ye I have no doubt
how can I do it properly then?
convert it?
copy to your apps local storage
that’s the only safe way to deal with files
i see
makes sense
<https://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/Environment.html#getExternalStorageDirectory()>
yes I am using this
already

> sure but I still need the path to the file
the file name is something you define usually
no I allow the user to choose a profile picture
and i get the path of the picture
in the system
even easier
but its not easy
lol
how does the user pick the picture?
you have to make 4 different solutions for different Api level
from any external content
depending on your picker you have the absolute path already
nope
i tried gallery
you almost never get an absolute path
I get a URI
in many cases the image may not even be on the device
i was assuming we were talking about picking an image from external storage
what I am doing is picking an image from the image gallery getting the path sending meta data to backend, recieve a presigned url and then upload the image as a file to aws s3
that way my backend does not have to handle images
The problem arises in many steps of that
1) many solutions to get absolute path depending on api level (I can copy the file to app local storage to resolve this)
2)ensuring the presigned data is properly parsed with retrofit
3)uploading the data ensuring its properly parsed

you could have a look at how the following libraries handled it:
<https://github.com/jkwiecien/EasyImage>
<https://github.com/jrvansuita/PickImage>
<https://github.com/brunodles/PicPicker>
no
Its done in anycase my only issue was the path
they are just for picking the images
which is trivial

there is `FileProvider#getUriForFile` in the v4 support lib if that helps
